title: 5G Scalable Hubs for Accessible and Resilient Education - [5G-SHARE]
abstract: He 5G-SHARE project represents a transformative, strategic leap in educational and research technology across Europe, uniting a consortium of 9 partners from 4 countries (Ireland, Romania, Czech Republic, and Italy), including 4 leading universities. The initiative focuses on deploying and interconnecting 4 advanced 5G Standalone (SA) Mobile Private Networks (MPNs), 3 of which will be newly installed, as Hybrid or Private, tailored to the specific 5G development needs of each country. By interlinking these networks, 5G-SHARE fosters collaborative, interoperable and secure scenarios that enhance cross-border data exchange, research innovation, and real-time applications. This infrastructure will support the implementation of 7 pioneering use cases spanning Extended Reality (XR) in education, Internet of Things (IoT) advancements, 3D content streaming, Artificial Intelligence (AI)-driven applications, and next-generation Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC). These use cases will leverage the ultra-low latency and high-speed capabilities of 5G to redefine industry standards, cybersecurity frameworks, and innovative learning methodologies. A core aspect of 5G-SHARE is knowledge-sharing and large-scale pilot adoption. Each use case will involve multi-partner collaboration, particularly in addressing security challenges and establishing best practices for replicability across diverse campus environments. A flagship initiative within the project, the Hybrid XR Learning use case, will be jointly developed across all university partners, engaging a vast network of students and faculty members while contributing to a shared content library for immersive education. 5G-SHARE will set a new benchmark for high-impact 5G-powered education and research across Europe, deploying scalable, large scale, cross-border pilots involving thousands of users that drive innovation, connectivity, and cybersecurity while shaping the future of EU society, academia, industry, and digital ecosystems.

title: SENTHICOM - Sense Think Communicate
abstract: UTCN drives a 140 GHz system-on-chip for next-generation multi-domain digital radar systems, covering design, prototyping, pilot manufacturing, and embedded software. The effort relies on AI/ML surrogate modeling for complex integrated circuits and parasitics across digital, analog, mixed-signal, and power management domains, alongside thermo-mechanical analysis, electromagnetic compatibility, and extensive testing (wafer probe, wire-bonding, wafer test, signal and power integrity).
themes: 140 GHz radar SoC for multi-domain sensing
AI/ML surrogate modeling for integrated circuits
Thermo-mechanical, EMC, and power integrity qualification
partners: National University of Science and Technology Politehnica Bucharest

title: EURODRIVES
abstract: UTCN advances next-generation automotive electronics and intelligent systems with low-power embedded platforms, computer vision for environment understanding (panoptic video segmentation and depth estimation), emerging microelectronics technologies, multi-physics analysis of automotive electronics, integrated circuit design for driver assistance, and hardware-software co-design validated through novel test platforms and procedures.
themes: Low-power embedded automotive systems
Panoptic segmentation and depth estimation for perception
Multi-physics modeling of automotive electronics
Hardware-software co-design and testing for driver assistance
partners: National University of Science and Technology Politehnica Bucharest

title: ASSET-IxC - Automotive Systems Smart Energy-efficient Transducers - Innovation across value Chain
abstract: The project delivers energy-efficient intelligent transducers for automotive systems, culminating in a head-up display that projects vehicle status and spatial orientation onto the windshield. UTCN ensures thermal integrity, high-speed performance, and the software foundation of smart transducers and advanced display systems to make them robust, accurate, and ready for integration.
themes: Energy-efficient intelligent transducers for automotive
Head-up display integration for driver awareness
Thermal integrity and high-speed performance for smart transducers
partners: National Institute for Research and Development in Microtechnologies
National University of Science and Technology Politehnica Bucharest

title: Ro-HydroHub - Romanian Hub for Hydrogen and New Energy Technologies
abstract: Ro-HydroHub brings together research and industrial partners to advance hydrogen and new energy technologies. UTCN focuses on fuel cell systems for electric vehicles and hybrid storage units, combining multi-physics modeling, energy management, and large-scale testing infrastructure to accelerate technology transfer and workforce upskilling.
themes: Modular multi-physics fuel cell platform for EVs
Energy management for hybrid storage in transportation
Hydrogen fuel cell testing and characterization facility
Hybrid storage units across vehicle and building energy exchange
Scaling fuel-cell know-how and technology transfer
partners: National University for Science and Technology Politehnica Bucharest
